website_summaries.verdict: Chewable vitamin with 35+ ingredients including minerals and nutrients all in one. Has added Kaneka Q10 a form of CoQ10 to promote cardio health and cell function.
pros: Promotes hip and joint function, immune support, and has chicken flavor dogs eat up
May give some dogs more energy, brighter eyes, and possibly improves disposition of older dogs
Good for dogs who are picky
cons: May give some dogs gas or diarrhea
not good for dogs with sensitive stomachs
Could be too crumbly and may not hold together when handled or in pocket

customer_reviews.title: He is one happy dude and back to his active self
customer_reviews.text: These vitamins did wonders for my dog! I have a 2 year old VERY active heeler with arthritis in his front shoulder. Before using these supplements he would get very stiff and sore and hobble around the house every night. We tried a bunch of other supplements but nothing really helped...until we tried these! After a few days he was not limping around at night and we could stop cutting back on his walks and ball time as we had to do before. He is one happy dude and back to his active self! And he will eat these things just like they're a treat!
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey

customer_reviews.title: They LOVE these!
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 recently rescued big dogs. They have had really poor eating habits till now. I added these to there diet and use them as treats. The dogs LOVE them and I do too. Packed with good stuff they need, you can see what happened the day I left these on the counter by mistake- see photo for the result. These are like gold on my household.
customer_reviews.author: LB Owen

customer_reviews.title: Better skin and coat, and more energy to boot!
customer_reviews.text: I have one Boston terrier with skin issues (itchiness, redness, allergies) and one with joint concerns due to age. Once I started feeding them these treats, the problems seemed to resolve within a couple of weeks! My fog with allergies is down to one Benadryl a day, previously 2 or 3 on bad days, and I'm going to try and go Benadryl free soon! And my senior dog has more energy than she's had in such a long time! I'd highly recommend you try these.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie Ciardelli

customer_reviews.title: GREAT VITAMINS! NOTABLE DIFFERENCE FOR MY DOGS!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best vitamin I have ever bought for my dogs. They are both seniors and now on home made food which can sometimes lack all the vitamins they need. After using these only a couple of weeks my dogs have more energy, want to play again, and their eyes seem much brighter and clear. They absolutely love them too! I will continue to use this product!
customer_reviews.author: Liz in Tucson

customer_reviews.title: I have found these vitamins are the best. I am very scientific and actually read the ...
customer_reviews.text: After 9 years of 2 pugs and 3 rescued weenie dog mixes, I have found these vitamins are the best. I am very scientific and actually read the content disclosure on the side label. They are the most potent and have the largest array of nutrients and supplements. Even the disposition of the oldest pugs has changed to where they are more active than ever. I just wish I could buy them in a larger bulk quantity since I have 5. Tim W.
customer_reviews.author: tim

customer_reviews.title: Worth the investment.
customer_reviews.text: For the last eleven and a half years I have been cohabitating with my retired racing greyhound, Romeo. Now that he’s into his thirteenth year of life, I’m noticing the unfortunate and unrelenting signs of age. Very depressing! I tried these vitamins on a whim. No one had recommended them. At first I saw no outward signs that they were “helping” him; but, as I neared the last few chewable I saw him begin to take more aggressive control of his walks (like my friend of old!). He’s now on his second jar and doing very well. It took a while; but, it was worth the wait.
customer_reviews.author: Galanor

customer_reviews.title: Umm,no
customer_reviews.text: Soooo, here's the tea- Bought this hoping to give my 3 dogs an all around supplement. Heres what happened: Gizmo ( long haired chihuahua)- wouldn't even touch it. Chalked it up to because he was a picky eater. If it's not meat related he wont eat it. Jin ( Schnauzer)- ate one and vomited during the night. Chalked it up to she has a sensitive stomach. Luna ( Husky)- had diarrhea both times I gave it to her. Sooo, yeah, I was not having a good time and tried it with all 3 of my dogs, all different breeds and sizes... I'll let you decide
customer_reviews.author: mango slices

customer_reviews.title: Same bad reaction as other reviewers
customer_reviews.text: A week into taking them my little dog started to experience the loose stool with blood. Pretty disappointing. After some research I found a website that showed most reviews were fake and this product has an F rating.
customer_reviews.author: Cindi

customer_reviews.title: Palm Oil
customer_reviews.text: I have to agree with earlier posts about the effect of palm oil on a dog. We used this product for about a week, 2-3 a day. Our dog was up most nights with diarrhea and vomiting. We were considering a trip to the vet and realized that these vitamins were the only thing that was new in her diet. Since we have thrown away the vitamin and the issues have resolved. Clearly, I would not buy this product again.
customer_reviews.author: M. Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Great for old dogs with joint and hip issues.
customer_reviews.text: My chocolate Lab loves these. He is a big ole boy(110lb) and is starting to show his age (he is 7). After he started taking these he has been more energetic and playful like he used to be. He thinks these are treats, please don’t tell them any different.
customer_reviews.author: Michael R.

customer_reviews.title: Too good to be true
customer_reviews.text: My dog has been taking these for the past month, I saw such an I'm improvement in my dog's energy and arthritis. But this morning she had a hard time going to the bathroom and when she finally did it was very irregular and soft. This is the only thing different in her diet and I'm just now reading about the palm fruit oil these vitamins contain and the health risks. So sad, I thought I had finally found something that works. Should have known it was too good to be true 😔
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: WANT TO STOP WHAT AILS YOUR DOG?? ZESTY PAWS
customer_reviews.text: Love all their products. Actually started with 'Allery Immune ' which made a vast improvement for my frenchie!!Cut her never ending sneezing and runny nose down by 85%-seriously!! Especially had hayfever like symptoms in the spring and fall. I now get the Multivitamins, Scoot Away, Omega Bites, and Cranberry Bladder Bites -these have totally slowed down her UTIs in half! Her vet is surprised as well!!
customer_reviews.author: Robyn Talbott

customer_reviews.title: these will make your dog sick
customer_reviews.text: I'm making homemade food to my dog, because of his sensitive stomach and needed a multivitamin to supplement, after few week notice my dog was having stomach problem and allergies, so i stop giving them.
customer_reviews.author: richypr70

customer_reviews.title: Great product - decent price!
customer_reviews.text: I can’t speak to the nutritional value because I don’t know specifically what vitamins and in what form dogs need. I leave that to the professionals and manufacturing companies. What I can tell you is that my dogs love these soft chew vitamins, they appear to provide everything under the sun, and they come in great packaging that protects the integrity of each chew. Very happy overall with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Dolores Sola

customer_reviews.title: Made dogs throw up
customer_reviews.text: Both dogs have been throwing up since taking them. One dog doesn’t like the flavor. The other seems to really enjoy it. Will not be giving to my dogs anymore. Waste of money for us.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with purchase
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these for my 9-year old spaniel and 4-Year old Pomeranian. They have been taking them (1/2 chewable) each day and I can tell a noticeable difference in their energy levels and their fur is so shiny and silky. Since Poms tend to have joint issues, I’m hoping that with continued use, this will also help with long term mobility and quality of life for my fur babies. Very pleased with purchase!
customer_reviews.author: McCoy1971

customer_reviews.title: New Lease on Life
customer_reviews.text: My 8 year-old Vizsla has been slowing down lately. She takes Cosequin DS for her arthritis pain, which does a fantastic job, but she has been sluggish. I ordered these vitamins to help with that, and the results have been nothing short of amazing. Within a week her energy was boosted, and now - 3 weeks later, she is like a puppy again. She literally runs top speed for 2-mile stretches, which she hasn't done in a long time. She doesn't sleep much during the day, opting to run around the yard and play. It's been an incredible transformation. I give her two per day, maybe I should just give her one- she's wearing me out!
customer_reviews.author: SBGAL

customer_reviews.title: You may want to think twice about these vitamins
customer_reviews.text: Very expensive! My Labrador wouldn't even get close to them. She's not a real picky eater but there was something in these she definitely didn't like. Worst of all THERE IS NO OPTION TO RETURN. So... you buy them and your dog don't like (or cannot tolerate...) them, you're screwed. And did I mention they are expensive? In a nutshell, a complete waste of money. VERY disappointed. How it ever got to be Amazon's Choice is beyond me... Next time, the first thing I'll check is the return policy. Lastly... when they ask you to rate them, why do they ask you to rate the "flavor"? I'm sorry, I don't eat dog vitamins.
customer_reviews.author: Schleeb

customer_reviews.title: Dog loves the added flavor, and helps her stay regular :)
customer_reviews.text: My whippet used to get bouts of indigestion and sometimes wouldn't eat if she decided to get out of her blanket during a cold night. I thought she could use more nutrition and probiotics so I did some searching and found this product. I can see why it has great reviews. My pup loves the added flavor and she's been regular/happier ever since she started eating this. I'm definitely going to continue giving this to my pup.
customer_reviews.author: BP

customer_reviews.title: REVISED REVIEW:  DONT BUY !!  Contains Palm Oil which is HIGHLY TOXIC TO DOGS & CATS
customer_reviews.text: Revision of prior review. DO YOUR RESEARCH BEFORE BUYING. I found out that this product contains PALM FRUIT OIL WHICH IS HIGHLY TOXIC TO DOGS AND HUMANS. Other products I’ve bought from Zesty Paws also contain Palm Oil which is a highly toxic cheap filler. I thought I was giving my dog the good stuff until I started researching the ingredients.
customer_reviews.author: Vicky M.

customer_reviews.title: TERRIBLE - DO NOT PURCHASE
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item because of the amazing reviews. I read through a ton and thought I had found the perfect supplement for my pug. BOY, WAS I WRONG. My poor dog was dripping blood from her anus about two week after her beginning the intake of this product. I removed the vitamins from her diet and the bleeding stopped. 0/10, zero stars if I could.. Do your fur babies and yourself a favor, and DO NOT BUY.
customer_reviews.author: leslie

customer_reviews.title: No way never again!!!
customer_reviews.text: These are awful and my dog completely refused to eat these! I tried several ways to get her to eat and no matter what I did she would not want anything to do with these. I’m suspecting the high reviews are not totally genuine as I was lured into trying these based on the reviews and my dog is not a picky eater yet fought not to eat these
customer_reviews.author: StephenShu

customer_reviews.title: Sick Dog! Don't buy!
customer_reviews.text: Shortly after purchasing these, within 3 weeks of starting my 90 lbs Pitbull on them, she was sick. No previous health problems, just aging and bad hips, we were hoping these would help her joint pain, instead, we've spent significant money at the Vet to find out her liver was suddenly bad. After stopping these treats/vitamins she has been recovering. I cannot say for certain that these treats caused her problem, but is it worth the risk?
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: A tasty multivitamin for dogs of all ages
customer_reviews.text: I started giving these to my Frenchie a few weeks back. She is only 2, so she is not in pain, but because of her breed I wanted to start her early on a multivitamin. The probiotic element has definitely helped her digestion as her farts have gotten immensely less stinky (she still farts, but doesn't clear the room anymore). Her coat seems a little more soft as well. She also thinks of them as treats so it is no trouble getting her to take one every day.
customer_reviews.author: Kerriann Jasinski

customer_reviews.title: made my dogs sick
customer_reviews.text: The packaging looks nice, it sounded like good ingredients and I really hoped it would work with my pups. I gave one to my 9 year old lab, and one to my 6 month old aussie. They both ate them and seemed to love the taste. A couple hours later they both got sick and threw up. It couldn't have been anything else, the vitamin was the only thing outside of their ordinary routine. I am disappointed. I tried returning, and it is "not eligible for return" even though it said this was an AMAZON PRIME item. I'm really disappointed I cannot return and I'm stuck with these things that cost me $25. Buy at your own risk.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon_Addict

customer_reviews.title: My Dogs Hate These
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: My dogs are not fans of eating these. They must not taste good. They smell fine. They are little heart shaped treats and are soft and powdery like. I have to make a big circus out of how awesome they are to get my dogs not to drop it on the ground. They eventually eat them but I’m forcing them too. They are not eager for them like they would be a treat, which is what I hoped for. I won’t be getting more. Also, I have a 39-lb and 57-lb dog and they each got 2 chews a day according to the directions.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Tate

customer_reviews.title: It didn't work for my Pom
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited to give my 4lb Pom these in hopes it would help with her hair growth. After two days, my Pom wakes up shaking and continues to shake until the afternoon. I wanted to ensure it was or wasn't the pills so I stopped giving them to her and the next day she was ok. I waited a couple of days to try them again (this time half the dosage) and again this morning she woke up shaking and with gas. They didn't work for my Pom.
customer_reviews.author: Edgar C

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this, made my dog sick!
customer_reviews.text: I wish I can give this product negative stars!!! I bought the vitamin based on all these glowing reviews however this product caused my dog to diarrhea all over our basement (this also included mucus) and puke everywhere. Save yourself some cleanup time/ vet bill and do not buy this!!!!! I will be returning this item!
customer_reviews.author: Shenna

customer_reviews.title: Sure, do your research  - I bet you'll still buy these
customer_reviews.text: I started looking for vitamins for my 8-year-old lab about a year ago because he started showing signs of pain after any exercise. I looked into multiple other dog vitamin products but the ingredients and number of positive testimonials made me choose these glucosamine joint support multivitamins - I haven't looked back since! There was a significant difference in his ability to move around and even his energy levels. They're now a daily staple in my now 9-year-old's diet and my 9-month-old lab's too!
customer_reviews.author: kstall

customer_reviews.title: These make both of my dogs sick.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my dog because she has a lot of skin and ear infection issues. I had hoped they would give her immune system a little boost, but they make her vomit everytime she takes one. Admittedly, she does have a sensitive stomach, but am surprised these have that effect. I then tried giving them to my other dog, for no reason other than I don't want them to go to waste. However, he also vomits after taking them. He does not have a sensitive stomach or any health issues at all.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Shreve

customer_reviews.title: Gave my Pomeranian bloody diarrhea :(
customer_reviews.text: I started giving my Pomeranian half a chew a day and noticed she started pooping blood after eating these. I thought it was her food but I stopped giving her the vitamins and she stopped pooping bloody diarrhea. I am going to the vet to see if everything is ok. I am very upset that you cannot return these.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Oshiro

customer_reviews.title: My Dogs HATED Them!
customer_reviews.text: I desperately needed an All-in-One dog vitamin and read the reviews on this. It was also listed as Amazon recommended. I ordered three containers. What a mistake! They smell awful and my dogs hated them. Refused to each them. I had already opened one container so I got stuck with that one, but I returned the other two which were still sealed. Do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: PhiladelphiaMom

customer_reviews.title: Dry and briddle, all my three dogs hated it.
customer_reviews.text: I have three dogs, one will eat anything and even he had to be coaxed to try this, he consequently had diarrhea. My other two dogs would not even touch it. It was not chewy at all but briddle And almost fell apart when you take it out of the container. I wanted to return it and was told that it’s an returnable. I’m waiting for a response from Amazon customer support.
customer_reviews.author: Veepka

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: We have a 13 yr old shepherd with arthritis. Have been advised by our vet to add to her diet fish oil and a few other supplements. We found multi vites and gave them a try, what a difference. Murphy now has a renewed energy and still keeps our high energy 3 yr old Male at bay always getting the upper hand at play. Will definitely continue using this product.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Morrow

customer_reviews.title: Improvement after 10-14 days
customer_reviews.text: One of my Whippets (Roxy, 7 yrs old) had a severe tendinitis reaction to a fluoroquinolone antibiotic, and was having a hard time lying down and getting up most days. Since starting this medication she is doing so much better! Still not chasing frisbees, but is much more active and doesn’t apoesr to be in pain. We are also giving it to our 10 yr old Whippet to help prevent joint pain that can come with age. The only problem is Roxy HATES it, but she has always been a little picky. Our other girl eats it just fine. Just ordered 2 more tubs.
customer_reviews.author: Kelg2

customer_reviews.title: Nice product, we really like them!
customer_reviews.text: My pup likes these! We give them to him once a day in the mornings after his morning walk as he goes nuts for them. I talked to my vet about them and he is a fan of Zesty Paws products. We’ve been using them for about a month now. I didn’t buy them for pain, my dog is 2 and in very good condition - we bought them because he has dry skin and the occasional stomach problem and they seemed to have helped quite a bit! He itches less and has less dandruff!
customer_reviews.author: Cori M Cowan

customer_reviews.title: Incredible customer service
customer_reviews.text: I bought these based on the great reviews. I forgot to check the ingredients and my dog might be allergic to chicken, which is in these. I called the 800 number on the side of the jar and instantly was speaking with a super friendly and understanding rep who said she would immediately send me out a different pumpkin flavored version with no chicken in it. And to just give away the ones I have. She said Zesty Paws has a 100% money back guarantee. So I didn't even have to go the usual Amazon return route. Wow. She was so personable and so nice. Thumbs, I mean Paws Up to Zesty Paws.....
customer_reviews.author: Amy Duluth

customer_reviews.title: This is the ONLY vitamin line that my dog will eat voluntarily - I'm on my 3rd order
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is great. First, my dog loves the taste. He'll take them voluntarily. Second, I know they have helped him with his stomach issues plus his joint issues. He recently had bilateral TPLO surgery, while taking the meds post surgery, the 5-in-1 multivitamins helped him recover quicker (Glucosamine & Chondroitin is always recommended) but also helped with stomach issues he normally has when taking antibiotics. Not only that, my boy has hypothyroidism and these don't interfere with his thyroid meds. I'll keep buying these as long as the benefits keep adding up!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Renee

customer_reviews.title: Will buy again
customer_reviews.text: I started to make my own dog food for my 3 shih tzu’s and was concerned that they may come up short on vitamins. Ordered these as well as the Zesty Paws for Seniors. I have really noticed a difference in my 2 senior girls. Both have a little more pep in their step. My 8 month old pup has the energy of 3 dogs but he gets his vitamin every morning also. Will definitely buy these again. Did compare to other vitamins and felt Zesty Paws was more complete and had what I felt my dogs needed.
customer_reviews.author: Workman

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: I gave this product about 3 weeks. Initially I wanted my hair pup to have the things he was missing from his regular meals. It actually just made him worst I feel. He had major problems with his digestive. Probably started happening around the second week.
customer_reviews.author: yohana_g

customer_reviews.title: Wow
customer_reviews.text: Have a 8 year old mini Australian Shepard that had slowly been feeling more sluggish. I was a little hesitant bc of the price but I'm so glad we purchased. After probably a week she started picking up her toys and bringing them to play with us, then she started barking and jumping when we came home and generally more energetic. I am 100% confident she has benefited from these supplements. I's sorry I didn't start her sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Best Pet Purchase Made!
customer_reviews.text: Our 2 yr old German Shepherd absolutely loves these! We’ve recently had issues with allergies and food sensitivity and were worried about adding anything new but due to the massive amount of hair she was losing daily and the lack of sheen to her coat, we took a risk and it definitely paid off. Every morning, first thing she sits in the kitchen by “her drawer” and waits for one of us to get the jar out and give her those 2 little hearts! Her coat is much thicker and has that sheen back to it. I also believe that it’s helped her energy levels. Zesty Paws absolutely gets a 2 thumbs up from us!
customer_reviews.author: Raven Black

customer_reviews.title: Want to keep HONEY as Healthy as possible
customer_reviews.text: My dog ate the multi-vitamins fairly easily. That made me Happy. I ordered because she is so spoiled on people food, mostly meat. She eats very little expensive dog foods. She is estimated to be about 9 years old Rescue Dog so the Hip & Joint supplements included along with 4 other vitamins help several other things like Digestion, Skin & Coat, Immune System & Heart. I've had HONEY for 5 years & LOVE her very much. I spoil her rotten & give her Revolution every month to prevent Fleas, Tick, Heart Worm & other Parasites.
customer_reviews.author: awesomefan

customer_reviews.title: I think this works. Dog likes them too.
customer_reviews.text: My 14 month old pit bull mix broke her back leg two times in two months. I gave this vitamin to her every morning for 60 days. She liked them. I was told her bone was healing above the vets expectations. I believe this product was a factor and I recommend it. I know my dog is young too and that helps. We also did physical therapy for 4 months, two times a week. I also gave my dog a joint powder. It’s not something I will do for her lifetime but during her healing I thought it was important. Here is the joint powder I used:
customer_reviews.author: piaknows

customer_reviews.title: 14 year old Shih Tzu doing better than ever
customer_reviews.text: My little old man (14) Gizmo was prescribed a crappy kibble diet by his vet (which wound up being a misdiagnosis of kidney disease) after 6 weeks of being on the food, all of his hair thinned out and he eventually stopped eating all together. I put him back on the diet he was on previously and added these vitamins. His coat was shiny and healthy after a month! Plus he loves the extra treat every day.
customer_reviews.author: carmelita darby

customer_reviews.title: Dog Will NOT Eat Them
customer_reviews.text: Our 1 yr. old dog Sam, will not eat these treats. I got him the beef flavored ones as he doesn't like peanut butter. No matter what I do he won't eat them. If I cut them up and mix it in with his food then he refuses to eat his food. He will eat it until he eats a piece and then that is it no more. I started just shoving them down his throat, but I shouldn't have too.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel W. Boren

customer_reviews.title: Good flavors?
customer_reviews.text: I make my own dog's food due to my dog's food allergies. To ensure that she gets adequate nutrients, I give her one tablet daily. Not sure how this helps my dog, but she doesn't have any adverse reactions that some reviewers mentioned here. The tablet is soft and easy to chew. My lhasa knows (expects) that she will get one after breakfast, and will eat it in 15 seconds. I guess flavors is good?
customer_reviews.author: MeeLoo

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: I should have read the negative comments. I was so excited for this product but it turned out to be dangerous. My dogs became very sick and I finally Figured out it was this. They were both throwing up multiple times a day, diarrhea, lethargic, not eating. This should be off the market. Apparently they use palm oil as a filler which is toxic to dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Hailey

customer_reviews.title: Good Glucosamine Source for Little Dogs Suffering From Occasional Luxating Patella
customer_reviews.text: Our little dog suffers occasionally from a minor luxating patella. Meaning her kneecap pops out of place here and there. At some points it gets so uncomfortable she limps, which of course is not good. We read that using Glucosamine could help, and after using some drops on her food we observed that it helped tremendously. The drops became unpalatable for her so we had to stop using them. Gave these a try and so far she's loved them. The same/similar benefit as the Glucosamine drops could be observed with these treats.
customer_reviews.author: Erik G.

customer_reviews.title: Not for my dog
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my dog because I wanted to make sure she was getting all of her vitamins. After 2 pills she had a severe gastrointestinal reaction. I immediately stopped giving her these and had to give her medication from her vet to resolve the issue. There is a no return policy on these so I am just out $25.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie C.

customer_reviews.title: Allergy problems
customer_reviews.text: I picked these out because they seemed to be well liked and had a lot of positive review and God know my fur baby seemed to love eating them down. But then the ear flapping and constant scratching started. While I've no doubt that the majority of dogs are fine with these, for my fur baby, they seemed to irritate him and cause a light allergic reaction so I had no choice but to take him off of them until I can find something new. Giving 3 stars because I haven't read too many where this has been mentioned and he did like the product. Unfortunately though, it wasn't worth continuing with where it was heading.
customer_reviews.author: Chaotic Cate

customer_reviews.title: This would have been perfect for my dogs, but....
customer_reviews.text: This would have been perfect for my dogs but one of them kept spitting the chew out. New out of the canister or having been aired out for a few days. After at least 6 months of this twice daily spitting out I accidentally got one wet while warming up the hot dog chunks to give them their hidden pill. I gave the old dog the wet one and he gobbled it right up. Now I run it under the warm water for a second before giving it to him and there is no longer a problem.
customer_reviews.author: R. Crespo

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: My guys eat these as if they’re special treats. My older boy is bounding around like a 2 year old after beginning to get a little stiff. His digestion has improved with no more diarrhea and he looks terrific. My 3 year old just goes and goes. We want to make sure they get the best nutritional supplementation and we believe that this is the best we could find. Absolutely endorse this as a high quality product that really makes a difference in our dogs’ health, digestion, activity levels, and general demeanor.
customer_reviews.author: R. Crosby

customer_reviews.title: Dogs seem to hate the taste & they’re crumbly
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately my dogs are really giving me a hard time with taking these. I even wrap them in pill pockets, and they still spit out chunks of these vitamins. They seem crumbly and messy so far. My dogs didn’t behave this way with the other brand of vitamins we tried previously. I’m going to keep trying, but it appears they do not like the way these taste. My large dog needs FOUR of them, and wrapping each one in a pill pocket makes it a time consuming process. I won’t purchase these again.
customer_reviews.author: ShawndyLee

customer_reviews.title: Oh boy...my dogs love these...
customer_reviews.text: Not only do they taste good (per my dogs excitement when I grab the jar), but I noticed almost immediately my older dog stopped limping (I have goldendoodles!)...I credit Zesty Paws...Stopped after 2 jars, and within 2 weeks his limp came back...Ordered immediately 2 more containers, and his limp is gone! Will not stop ordering!
customer_reviews.author: Happy in Florida

customer_reviews.title: Great product and my dog loves them
customer_reviews.text: My pets mean everything to me. They get the best food and vitamin supplements to ensure they live long healthy lives. My dog, Chesney, is an Australian Shepherd with tons of energy. We have been using this supplement for 6 months and he hasn’t been sick once. He lives the taste and will do commands in order to get them, even when my four-year-old granddaughter is the one dishing them out. If I go in the kitchen in the morning he is hot in my heals to get his vitamins. I have been very happy with this product and have it on automatic shipment so we never run out!
customer_reviews.author: Chandra

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Supplements!
customer_reviews.text: My little Shih Tzu Gilligan loves Zesty Paws treats. He doesn't itch or have diarreah anymore after taking them. I just crumble one treat in the evening with his dinner or I give it as a treat. His energy is like a puppy and he's 7 years old. He jumps and plays endlessly. These treats are extremely nourishing and full of good nutrients. He would never get this kind or level of nourishment from any dog food. These are great supplements to add to any dogs diet. It's very important to me that my precious little Gilligan gets all the nutrients his body needs everyday. With Zesty Paws I don't have to worry anymore!!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah P.

customer_reviews.title: Not for dogs with heart issues!
customer_reviews.text: This product is sold as a heart support vitamin. But do not give it to your dog if it has any heart issues. It contains cod liver oil and flax seed, two things that are really bad for dogs with any heart conditions. Flax seed lignons are good for dogs with heart issues, but that's very different from flax seed. Cod liver oil is bad for the dog's heart, instead omega 3's are important. Maybe there's no harm in giving these to healthy dogs, but not good for dogs with CHD!
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: I read all the good and bad reviews for this product and decided to ...
customer_reviews.text: My 16 year old dog had PICA, she would eat dirt (and other things) obsessively. I have been to the vet it has been a battle. I read somewhere vitamins could help. I read all the good and bad reviews for this product and decided to buy it. I am on day 5 and she has totally stopped eating anything but food. The only thing that has changed is her getting these. So, I am a believer and will now give them to all 3 of my dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Carlson

customer_reviews.title: Balance and boost immune system
customer_reviews.text: This is the 4th of their products ive bought. My puppy is incredibly picky and she just refuses to eat anything that doesnt please her. She thinks these little soft chews are “cookies”. I just leave it by her dish and she scoots off with it. I tried other other products to balance her diet and boost her immune system but shell just let it stay there. She is a mixed breed rescue and had a number of challenges from birth. I love the chews because i can seewhen shes eaten the whole thing. Powders may or may not get consumed depending on her
customer_reviews.author: Sunny Artist

customer_reviews.title: Money wasted-Gave my dogs diarrhea
customer_reviews.text: I was hopeful for this supplement since I have used other zesty paw supplements with success. I gave it a shot with my two dogs (10 and 8 lbs) for about two weeks. They both had either very soft stools or diarrhea. I know it is the supplement because that’s the only thing that has changed in their diet. I also took them off of it one day and the poop became firmer. Neither of them were interested in eating the supplement by itself so I mixed it into food. Disappointed in this supplement and expected better from zesty paws.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsie A.

customer_reviews.title: This has helped my dog.
customer_reviews.text: My senior Beagle has had a very difficult time with her tummy. She's been to the veterinarian many times for the problem with little change. I gave this to her and while she isn't super excited to get her "treat", she will eat it but she saves it for late in the day. After a week or so, I noticed that she had less gas, and that had been a frequent issue for her. In about two weeks, she didn't seem to have diarrhea anymore. I wouldn't say this has been a cure, but it certainly improved the quality of her life and for that I am very grateful.
customer_reviews.author: Emma Anderson

customer_reviews.title: I noticed a difference in my senior dog
customer_reviews.text: I am beginning the second month of feeding this supplement, I have noticed a great improvement in my aging border collie. I noticed that she had begun to "dull" for lack of a more specific term, had less luster for life and was losing that brightness in her eye, etc. I started her on these and have noticed a great difference in her, she seems more upbeat and ready to play. I am really satisfied. I am feeding these to my 12 lb PomSki mix as well, she is only 6 months old, I feel good about giving her what she needs while growing. I am happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: E. Weller

customer_reviews.title: Diarrhea and loss of appetite
customer_reviews.text: I would NOT recommend this precut at all! I gave one to my one year old German Shepherd pup and after some little time (maybe 1-2 hours) he wanted to go outside. He had very liquid stool and it’s been all day long. He haven’t eaten anything half of that day and left us a “surprise” on the carpet on the next morning. I tried one more time and everything the same happened. My poor baby(( I don’t give him this “vitamins” anymore and unfortunately I can’t return the product and get a refund.
customer_reviews.author: elena

customer_reviews.title: overall good but...
customer_reviews.text: Looks like good and quality product. Nice ingredients and vitamins that your dog need but in my case probably im not the only one but my dog would not even com close to them. He would not eat them or even come close. Not sure why but that's what happened. I bought other multivit for dogs which are 1/3 the price and he loves them. He could eat them all day everyday but not these unfortunately. But remember this.. my dog is not your dog. Your dog might love them :)
customer_reviews.author: Lucas

customer_reviews.title: Your dog will love the flavor but I’ll cause potential diarrhea.
customer_reviews.text: As far as I know this is an ok supplement that my dogs love the taste of.! I haven’t used it long enough to give a full review but I have noticed my dogs poo is pretty mushy and wet. I’ve been thinking it was something else but as I read other users reviews of the same experience I will proceed with it with caution. If your dog is prone to diarrhea then I would avoid this product. The 1st ingredient is palm fruit oil which would explain the wet stools. The oil does have some health Benefits but I don’t feel The benefits outweigh the negative environmental impact it causes in their native environments.
customer_reviews.author: Madhatta31

customer_reviews.title: They love their multi vitamin!
customer_reviews.text: I love that these come in easy bite size pieces that can be broken up if needed. All 3 of my dogs love the vitamins! They think they're getting treats! They stay fresh in the easy open container too!
customer_reviews.author: J. Snyder

customer_reviews.title: Liked another but this one didnt agree with my dog
customer_reviews.text: I have had good luck with another zesty paws product but not so much with this one..Something in the formula didnt agree with her and made her sick....Good CS in any case...Conveninet form to give as a treat if your dog will eat it and if it agrees with them. .I was promised a free jar for leaving feedback but will have to give it to someone else to try. I paid full price for my jar...As you can see I wasnt told I had to leave great feedback so this is my honest opinion...
customer_reviews.author: Kimbercin

customer_reviews.title: Soft  and tasty for my chihuahua
customer_reviews.text: I’m honestly not sure if the taste because obviously I’m not the one eating it, my 7 year old chihuahua is. She actually likes it. Have to forcefully Put it in her mouth at first so she can taste it but after that she started getting used to it. It’s been less than a month so I don’t know what improvements there are as my dog is a sleeping dog, yet active when she wants. It’s been the same so far. I just notice she sits more slumpy one one side only. Best part of this is that the vities are soft! My dog has 3 teeth left and these crumble softly. Plus on the soft chews
customer_reviews.author: vaness

customer_reviews.title: I just love these bites
customer_reviews.text: I just love these bites! Our dog seems to show more energy and overall doing well on these. He has taken them for one month and I'm buying more and plan to keep him on these tasty bites. I like the ingredients used and like what isn't used as well. The dog takes these as if it were his favorite treat. I've gotten other products only to have them spit out. There is nothing bad to be said about this company.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: NOPEEEEE
customer_reviews.text: I have never written a product review. However, my dog's health is a very big concern as it may be for most of you who read this. My German Shepherd poos as if she is peeing that's how bad it is. She doesn't eat at all and that is the only thing that has been added to her diet. Save your self a couple of bucks and your dog's health. Don't please.
customer_reviews.author: Narbeh

customer_reviews.title: Very Impressed
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to supplement my pups diet. I feed them high-end kibble and raw meat, but they are getting older. Sasha especially was showing some joint/pain issues so I was especially keen to try them. After a month of use she is doing much better and has no problem jumping up on the couch/bed or climbing stairs. She has alot more energy and is back to her playful self (she's the goofy one in the photo). Update: I continue to purchase these because they really work!
customer_reviews.author: Zenpuppy

customer_reviews.title: Happy Dog, Happy owner
customer_reviews.text: Happy mini pincher and happy owner. I was looking for a product with out yeast and found this almost all in one with flax seed and pumpkin and all around good ingredients. My dog eats these with her regular raw diet and seams to be thriving. It is a product with no extra fillers like peas or potatoes. Give it a try your little or big buddy will thank you with good health and love.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Com

customer_reviews.title: He likes it, Hey Mikey!
customer_reviews.text: My dog is very picky when it comes to "supplements" and healthy freeze dried treats no matter how organic, pure, grass fed or expensive usually don't get eaten (and $$ down the drain). I was very surprised that for the last week he has been happy to eat these daily. Not sure of any changes in energy, mobility or coat yet as he's 6 years old and was healthy to begin with. I am just happy he eats these along with his DuckBites freeze dried Superfood treats and Greenies! Yay, at least he's getting extra nutrition/vitamins to supplement the organic lamb and chicken I feed him (and practically the only thing he'll eat).
customer_reviews.author: Maria S

customer_reviews.title: Please remove and ignore my review from before
customer_reviews.text: Most vitamins contain the product, palm fruit oil, that is a source of distress in animals and has a cumulative effect. Check with vet sites and information. This saddens me greatly, as my dogs loved this item, but it is not a good idea. Search, diligently, for a product that prides itself on NO palm fruit oil (Amazon has some). At the least, check with your vet.
customer_reviews.author: J-C

customer_reviews.title: BEST PRODUCT PROVEN RESULTS
customer_reviews.text: Tucker our Chocolate Lab. Was chewing rocks and all sorts of weird things. It was found he was lacking some important nutrients. We tried other Vitamins and Mineral supplements. But no changes and some he refused to eat. ZestyPaws not only showed results within the first 3 days. But his coat, nails, and over all body language was positive, healthy and loads of energy. Loves the favor, eats them with or without food, the ingredients are exactly what they say they are and his not chewing rocks and other items proved that. Highly recommended....
customer_reviews.author: LEBEAU75

customer_reviews.title: Returned
customer_reviews.text: They instantly (with food) gave my dog an awful stomach ache. Returned immediately. Most people will say stay away from Palm Fruit Oil, but do your research on it, there's Palm Fruit Oil in almost every product these days, you just never noticed it until now.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Great vitamin
customer_reviews.text: I started my dog on a homemade diet and love the experience and how she can't wait to eat. This is a decision I made with my vet, and while she supports this diet, she also recommended a multivitamin to make sure I covered all my bases. Since adding Zesty Paws to my dog's diet, she is happy, energetic, and loves her "treat". The ingredients and nutritional content is on point. I'm confident in this product and happy at how well my dog is responding. She's full of life, spunk, and energy.
customer_reviews.author: Ana Zaun

customer_reviews.title: No way of knowing if these work until you try them. Some dogs can handle them some can’t.
customer_reviews.text: Just received this product today, gave our 1 year old Dachshund one and gave our 12 year old Dachshund. The 1 year old started throwing up and has diarrhea, the 12 year old seems to be fine, has had no side affects. I had read a few of the reviews before I purchased these, most of the reviews were very positive BUT there were a few stating that this vitamin made their dog sick, but I thought I would give them a try anyway. So basically there is a 50/50 chance that your dog will get sick like ours did. Good Luck!
customer_reviews.author: R. Brooks

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for our dog
customer_reviews.text: Didn't notice any positive changes in our dog. Our dog got a rash amd bumps on his belly near the genital area that began to bother him. The vet suggested this may be due to something new in our dogs diet. We discontinued these vitamins and the skin rash went away.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn S

customer_reviews.title: Seems like theyd work great but not for my dog at the time
customer_reviews.text: My dog did a course of doxy for Lyme and i thought id try these to help out his stomach as he was eating grass and not feeling well.We noticed from day one he had more diarrhea so he only took them for a few days.we havent tried them again yet but we plan to
customer_reviews.author: Lisa A. Roberts

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves this .
customer_reviews.text: My SENIOR dog loves this he think they are treats. I started giving these to my dog because of health issues. Its been thirty days and he has perked up. I have ordered more. The vet even said my dogs gums look better. (I will keep my senior pup on this.) My dog looks forward to this every morning.
customer_reviews.author: smckinney

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves these
customer_reviews.text: Took a chance on trying this multivitamin, read good reviews on this. Our Aussie is getting older and limps when getting up and slowing down in general. She jumps more, prances like a deer and walks are longer and stronger. She get 2 chews in the morning and she is good to go. She is definitely more alert. This is a must have not to be without.
customer_reviews.author: Divy Karolyi

customer_reviews.title: My dogs love them
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for both of my dogs as one dog is almost 13 years old and the other is 4 years old with 3 legs and is sensitive to grains. I figured what do we have to lose,if it helps with her sensitivity then it's a win/win. Looks like her body likes these vitamins and it has helped with the grain sensitivity because she isn't itchy and scratchy like before when she was taking these vitamins.thr concern is she is susceptible to kidney stones and was put on a prescription dog food that was not grain free - and these vitamins have helped! So now I have these set up on auto ship and my dogs love them!
customer_reviews.author: C.N.

customer_reviews.title: Beau approved!
customer_reviews.text: Love these! Looked around for a good overall vitamin and joint care for my pup and have been nothing but pleased. He’s slowly turning into an old man, so even though he’s still quite active, after a full eventful day sometimes I’ve noticed a little limp from him when he’s walking. Been giving these to him for a few months now and I’ve noticed a significant difference in his mobility. Crumbles easily right over his food or I give it to him on the side as a treat. For reference - Beau is a 5 year old, 70 lbs pitbull/ American bull dog mix that can be quite the picky eater
customer_reviews.author: Kara

customer_reviews.title: Couldn’t get my dogs to eat them !!!
customer_reviews.text: The description of this product and the Reviews led me to try these for my six dogs, ages ranging from 8-12 years. I thought this would be good for them. But I could not get any of them to eat them !!!! I tried breaking them into pieces - that didn’t work. I tried wrapping them in cheese, then bacon — they ate the cheese & bacon but spit out the vitamin !!! So obviously, they did not like the flavor at all !!! I don’t know if these helped my dogs bc I could never get any of them to eat them ! I gave them to a friend for her dog.
customer_reviews.author: Charlene Gore

customer_reviews.title: Seemed already used or open
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product a couple of months ago and I just openned it, but I didn't like the fact that plastic wrap was just a loose line and inside it didn't come with protective carton lid as they usually come. It gives me the impression it was already used or open. Won't be given it to my babies for caution. I hope I can ask to get my money back :C
customer_reviews.author: MarinaFlor

customer_reviews.title: Packaging was broken when arrived.
customer_reviews.text: The product smells strong, like dog food (not a big deal) but my dog always spits it out about 4 times before he actually eats it which makes me think that the taste must not be very good. As long as they work, that's what I care about. However, the packaging was TERRIBLE, when I received the package, It was broken some vitamins had fallen out due to the lid breaking off during shipment, I stored them in plastic bags as a backup but it was an inconvenience.
customer_reviews.author: Francisco and Cheyenne

customer_reviews.title: It's easy to break apart and he can swallow it easily ...
customer_reviews.text: Our dog had oral cancer and lost most of his teeth. We have to hand feed him and we know he's not getting enough nutrients. We tried to supplement him with his multivitamin. It's easy to break apart and he can swallow it easily without the hassle of grinding or wrapping it up in cheese. The other healthy dog loves it too. We think she's the one that's gaining weight so we try to only give her half. Thanks for this product Zenwise Health.
customer_reviews.author: ramoné

customer_reviews.title: Silky gorgeous coat
customer_reviews.text: I have been feeding these to my puppiy since she was three months old, about three months, and she goes crazy for them. First thing in the morning she follows me to where the jar is and goes through her routine of tricks to receive a couple. Her coat is absolutely gorgeous and she is probably the healthiest and happiest dog you have ever seen. People comment about how silky her fir is and how beautiful she is all the time. Thank you so much for your multivitamin treats, She is one happy healthy girl!
customer_reviews.author: kellydean1111

customer_reviews.title: Picky Boxer is OBSESSED
customer_reviews.text: My boxer eats ALL the things, except when it comes to vitamins. I had been noticing that she is slowing down and seemed to have some stiffness in the mornings (she's 9, not overweight but built shorter and stockier). I bought another brand that were way too big of pills, chalky, and she had NO interest in them; I was grinding them up and putting them in her food but they destroyed my small processor. I bought these after reading the reviews hoping that she would eat them without the fuss. SHE LOVES THEM. She thinks they're treats. She's only been taking them for a short while, but I feel like I see an improvement in her stiffness and energy.
customer_reviews.author: Allison

customer_reviews.title: Manufacturer would not answer one simple question.
customer_reviews.text: Manufacturer would not answer my question no matter how many ways I tried to contact them. The question was simple. What quantity of Palm Oil Fruit is in their product and is it actually dangerous for my dog? The company never even attempted to respond.
customer_reviews.author: Karl Davidson

customer_reviews.title: Smoother coat, real results in just a week's time
customer_reviews.text: A friend of mine recommended these after getting a jar for his aging dog. He said it helped her arthritis, mobility, energy and also made her coat feel much smoother. I was skeptical at first but within a week of giving one per day to my terrier/bichon mix his coat became much smoother, his breath smelled better, and his energy levels were improved. Going to keep this product in his diet long term to supplement his regular food. He loves the taste and his ears perk up when I ask if he wants to take his vitamins. LOL. Definitely recommended for a smoother coat and overall health support.
customer_reviews.author: Todd G

customer_reviews.title: Good for stomach balance
customer_reviews.text: I have a 14 year old that was vomiting intermittently. Getting shots taking cerenia, so I have put her on antibiotics and switched her to a "light and fit Acana food" and seems to be doing the trick. Blood work had shown pancreatitis so after a couple of months now I see great improvement, no more meds and the esophageal regurg seems to have subsided 80%.
customer_reviews.author: AussiegirlIngridTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Multivitamin and Probiotic
customer_reviews.text: My dog is a 7 yr old Lab, no joint or medical problems and is active. He has an occasional grumbly stomach and I had been giving a probiotic powder to him (a pain to mix in his food). Your bites are much easier to give him. My dog ate them up no problem, later I just crumbled 2 ea of your multivitamin and 2 ea of your probiotic into his food in the morning for the last 45 days. No grumbly stomach issues. I do think that the multivitamins are beneficial and am still watching him to see if I noticed any difference.
customer_reviews.author: Vinnie W

customer_reviews.title: Some Dogs Like the Taste
customer_reviews.text: I have a 8 month old pup (rhodesian ridgeback) who really loves these, along with anything else he can get into his mouth:) I also have an older basset hound, who doesn't like the smell/taste, so I must coat these "treats" with peanut butter to get her to eat one. These are probably healthy for both dogs, but only one of them finds them tasty. Observing both dogs before and after, I don't think these multi vitamin treats provide any pain relief, as they're not advertised as pain relief for dogs anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Stevie Wonder

customer_reviews.title: Dried out
customer_reviews.text: My dogs usually love these! but i just opened our new bottle, they are dried out and crumble. My dogs wont even eat them. This brand is typically great though! i think i just got a bad batch.
customer_reviews.author: Stacky

customer_reviews.title: Tastes bad to dogs
customer_reviews.text: The dogs would not eat it even wrapped in bacon. Got tired of trying to get them to eat the pill even in peanut butter they we would spit out the pill.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Jefferson

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my dogs active & healthy
customer_reviews.text: A multivitamin for my dogs. They think it is just a treat but it helps keep them healthy. My Min Pin has a problem with his knee cap on his back leg from birth. He was previously limping but now he runs with no apparent favoring of that leg! This is my second jar. I’m sold on this supplement!
customer_reviews.author: Teresa Honeycutt

customer_reviews.title: My dogs love them
customer_reviews.text: My dogs have been taking theses daily now for about 3 weeks. I have an older cocker spaniel with an ACL injury, I have noticed a big difference with his ease of walking. We also have 3 large breed dogs (Great Pyrenees, and 2 Bernese Mountain Dogs) they are taking these mainly for maintenance because they are 4 yrs old and younger. I have noticed a difference in their coats, very healthy looking. They also have no issues with eating theses, where some other brands they were finicky about.
customer_reviews.author: A. Kirkpatrick

product_meta.title: Zesty Paws Multivitamin Treats for Dogs - Glucosamine Chondroitin for Joint Support + Digestive Enzymes & Probiotics - Grain Free Dog Vitamin for Skin & Coat + Immune Health - Chicken Flavor - 90ct
feature_bullets: DAILY 5-IN-1 FORMULA - Zesty Paws Multivitamin Bites are chewable treats with vitamins, minerals, and nutrients that support the skin, coat, joints, heart, digestive function, and immune response for dogs of all ages, breeds, and sizes.
SKIN & COAT CARE - This anti itch formula contains Cod Liver Fish Oil and Vitamin E to help skin and coats

POWERFUL HIP & JOINT SUPPORT - Each dog chew features OptiMSM, a GRAS-designated distilled form of MSM. This mobility boosting ingredient works with the Glucosamine HCL and Chondroitin Sulfate in these chews for hip and joint health.

DIGESTIVE ENZYME & PROBIOTICS - These chews also contain Digestive Enzymes, Niacin, and a five-strain Probiotic (500 million CFU per chew) to promote healthy digestion for dogs that struggle with gas, diarrhea, constipation, and bloating.

HEART & IMMUNE HEALTH - Multivitamin Bites feature Kaneka Q10, a pure CoQ10 compound that that promotes healthy cardiovascular function, while Vitamin A, C and E provide powerful antioxidant support to bolster the immune system.
